medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports 3 days of right lower quadrant abdominal pain that primarily occurs at night, occasionally waking him from sleep. The pain is insidious in onset and has no associated symptoms. The patient denies fevers, chills, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension and gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). No history of abdominal surgeries.
